metadata.title: CVE-2021-23984 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A malicious extension could have opened a popup window lacking an addressbar. The title of the popup lacking an address bar should not be fullycontrollable, but in this situation was. This could have been used to spoofa website and attempt to trick the user into providing credentials. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
